title.ref: «XV. Trondheim» I: Decretales ineditae saeculi XII

p.hi: Alexander III to Archbishop Eystein of Trondheim. Dispensation from the rules against consanguineous marriages for people living on an island twelve-days journey from Norway. Those who live in such isolated communities, in what most inhabitants are related, and who cannot travel abroad to seek marriage partners may be permitted to marry within the fifth, sixth, and seventh degrees.

div.p: Alexander III Trundensi archiepiscopoPraemonenda: Textum in cod. C severe damnatum est (vide in commento)Erundensi P

Ex diligenti relatione nuntiorum tuorum nostristu/// nostris C est auribus intimatum quod insula quedam a Norwegiaa ///weiga C per xii. dietasdietas] dies Cac et> ampliuset – tibi] et amplius/// an/// (vel in ///a ?) es/// C (ubi forsan t sequi uidetur) distat, in qua episcopatus tibitibi scripsi cum Skåland (cf. C): tui male P metropolicometropolico CP: non curavi emendandam formam rariorem (alibi saepius metropoliticus, -a, -um) quae etiam legitur e.g. in Inn. III registro 1 ep. 316 (edd. Hageneder-Haidacher 1.449 lin. 6, 26) iure subiectus existereiure – existere] iu/// esse (vel em?)/// C perhibeturperhibeatur Skånl., cuius itaque parochiani ita sibi inuicem dicuntur contingeresibi inuicem dicuntur contingere] /// consanguinitate uel aff/// contigere C quod matrimonia inter se uix aut nunquam legitimematrimonia – legitime] matrimonium uix/// legitime C possunt contraherepos///t contra/// C, presertim cum difficile sit eis–et pauperibus fere impossibile–terram hac occasione exire et aliunde uxores querere.cum difficile – querere] cum diffi/// isse (vel ossi ?)/// terram /// aliunde uxores/// C Quare a nobis iamdicti nuntiiQuare – nuntii] /// nobis iamdicti nu/// C tui instantius postulant ut illius insule populo debeamuspostulant – debeamus] postulabant ut/// deberemus C super hiis utilius prouidere et aliquam inde facere dispensationem.utilius – dispensationem] u/// aliquam inde (uim ante corr.) facere di/// C Nos siquidem in sanctorum patrum constitutis et sacrisconstit/// sacris C canonibus aliquam in huiusmodihuiusmodi ///sacionem C dispensationem non legimus generaliter factam fuisse, nisi quod beatus Gregorius Anglis nouiter ad fidem conuersis ut in iiii°. gradu matrimonium contrahere possent indulsit, quod ipse idem postea reuocauit.Cf. Gregory I, Reg. ep. 11.56a (JE 1843; AD 601) c.5 and the excerpt from the spurious letter JE ✝1334, which were combined by Joh. Diaconus, Vita Greg. M. cc.37-38 (PL 75.101-2) and so handed down in canonical collections from Regino of Prüm (app. II c.2) to Gratian C.35 q.2-3 c.20; also cited by Alexander II, JL 4500, cf. C.35 q.5 c.20. Vnde quoniam scripta nostra super talibus legem facere nonnon C marg.: om. P consueuerunt, certum tibi inde responsum dare nullatenus potuimus. Verumtamen si ab aliis insulam prescriptam terris per xii. dietas,dietas] dictas Cac sicut audiuimus, constet distare et eius populo tantam in hiis necessitatem noueris iminere, tu ascitis tibi suffraganeis tuis cum suo et aliorum religiosorum uirorum consilio poteris dispensare et supradicto populo ut in v°. et vi°. et vii°. gradu contrahant matrimonium indulgere, donec omnipotens Dominus tantam ab eis aufert necessitatem. In quarto autemautem bis scr. P gradu et infra dispensationem fieri prohibemus
Tradition: Cott. 2.26 (=C), Pet. 1.30 (=P).
Printed: W.H. in DA 2 (1938) 383-84 (=C); in part Skåland in Historisk Tidsskrift 41 (1961-62) 137 (=P: «Ex diligenti – dispensationem» lin. 1-9

p.hi: Alexander III to Archbishop Eystein of Trondheim. Permission to consecrate a biship of Oslo to succeed Thorstein, murdered by some of his subjects. The part of the diocese in which the murder took place should be deprived of episcopal presence forever; and the procuration which rightly belongs to the biship and the administration of the sacrament of confirmation («privilegium consignandi» should be transferred to other parts of the diocese at the bishop's will. The pope is amazed that the king of Norway has not avenged the crime.

div.p: WH 710; JL – (?) Benevento, December 1169
Alexander III Trudensi archiepiscopo.Idem C

Peruenit ad nos quod bone memorie quondam Asloensis///am Asloen/// Asleon. P episcopus in quadam parte parochie sue a quibusdam perditionis filiis fuit crudeliter interemptus. Vnde licet tam piaculare flagitium grauissima sit animaduersione plectendumplectendum] puniendum P, nos tamen postulatione tua inducti deuotioni tue auctoritate apostolicaapostolica///mus C concedimus ut in AsloensiAllocensi CP ecclesia episcopum ualeas ad honorem Dei et ecclesie ordinare, ita quidem ut illa pars episcopatus ubi tantum sacrilegium habuit exordium pontificali presentia perpetuo debeat carere, et diocesani episcopi procuratioprocurare P, que illumillum qui qui male P de om. P de iure contingit, necnon et priuilegiumpriuilegium coniecit Holtzm.: pium CP consignandi ad alias partes eiusdem diocesis pro ipsius episcopi arbitrio deferantur. Miramur autem, quodquod om. P tamen necnec tamen tr. P sufficimus admirari, quod karissimus in Christo filius noster illustris Norweie rex tam horrendum scelus secundum collatamcollectam male C (coniecit Holtzm. sibi a Domino postestatem distulit uindicareuendicare P.
Tradition: Cott. 5.29 (=C), Pet. 4.40 (=P).
Printed: W.H. in DA 2 (1938) 391 no. 7 (=C).

p.hi: Alexander III to Archbishop Eystein of Trondheim and his suffragans. Order that no cleric may devise to his relations or other secular heirs property which he obtained through his church. If any cleric of the province dies intestate, all such property should revert to the church in which he served. Property possessed by hereditary right may also be left to the church.

div.p: Alexander IIIAlexander CP Trundensi archiepiscopo et eius suffraganeis.

Ad aures nostras perlatum fuisse cognoscatiscognoscatis scripsi: cognoscas P, non leg. C quod quidam de clero uobis commisso non eam quam debente///quam C deberent P circa salutem suam sollicitudinem et curamet curam non leg. C adhibentes, ea que ipsis per ecclesias proueniuntproueniunt] ///nt C magis uolunt consanguineisconsanguin///s C et heredibus aliisaliis] et praem. P suis secularibus relinquere quam eisdem ecclesiis de quarum bonis fuerant acquisita. Quidam etiam hec, etsi uellent, non possunt implere, quoniam legi uestre contraire noscuntur. Vnde quoniam ea que sanctorum patrum obuiant institutis alicuius consuetudinis obtentu non suntsunt] possunt C a Christiane professionis uiris aliquatinus obseruandaobseruandi C, auctoritate apostolica statuimus ut, si aliquem clericum in uestris parochiis intestatum decedere forte contigerit, uniuersa eius bona que ipsi per ecclesiam prouenerunt, ad ecclesiam cuius clericus fuit nullius contradictione et appellatione obstante libere reuertantur. Si autem ea que iure hereditario possidet uoluerit ecclesie cuius clericus fuit relinquere, id efficendi liberam habeat facultatem.
Tradition: Cott. 4.73 (=C), Pet. 3.78 (=P).
Printed: W.H. in DA 2 (1938) 386-87 no. 3 (=C); in part Skånland in Historisk Tidsskrift 41 (1961-62) 138 (=P: 'Ad aures – statuimus' lin. 1-99).

p.hi: Alexander III to Archbishop Eystein of Trondheim and his suffragans. Response to miscellaneous questions (a) on the beginning and end of feastdays, and the observation of feasts with an octave; (b) on the canonical penance for homocide and it modifications; (c) on days and times at which liturgical genuflection is not permitted, and on genuflection during ordinations; (d) on regional differences regarding the date of the feast of the Holy Trinity, which the Roman Church itself does not celebrate; (e) on the cases in which an alter has to be reconsecrated, without any need for reconsecrating the church in which it stands; (f) on the removal from all service at the alter of a priest who has killed a pagan; (g) on the restitution to office, after penance, of priests who have lived in socalled marriage with a concubine.

div.p: Alexander III Trundensi archiepiscopo et eius suffraganeis.Alexander – suffraganeis scripsi: Alexander III Trundensi (Trudensi SAb; Terdonensi Cp; Ternoc.
